qas.question: Who denounced Jewish People in many of his writings?
What were the Jews described as enemies of?
According to Pope St. Gregory what religion must you be in order to be a heretic?
In what culture of law were Jews and heretics often lumped together?
What pope defended Judaism and the Jewish people?
Who described Christ as the enemy of the Jews?
What did Pope St. Gregory call all Jewish teachings?
Who did Roman law indentify as heretics?

context: <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>Pope St. Gregory<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> stigmatized Judaism and the <a2_0>Jewish<a2_0/> People in many of his writings. He described Jews as enemies of <a1_0>Christ<a1_0/>: "The more the Holy Spirit fills the world, the more perverse hatred dominates the souls of the Jews." He labeled all <b6_0>heresy<b6_0/> as "Jewish", claiming that Judaism would "pollute [Catholics and] deceive them with sacrilegious seduction." The identification of <b7_0>Jews<b7_0/> and heretics in particular occurred several times in <a3_0>Roman-Christian law<a3_0/>,
